thread.title: Fat Joe & Remy Ma Talk Being The Best In The Game, Memories of Big Pun, Staying Independent & More | The Breakfast Club | The Beat 92.3 and 96.7
thread.title_full: Fat Joe & Remy Ma Talk Being The Best In The Game, Memories of Big Pun, Staying Independent & More | The Breakfast Club | The Beat 92.3 and 96.7

title: Fat Joe & Remy Ma Talk Being The Best In The Game, Memories of Big Pun, Staying Independent & More | The Breakfast Club | The Beat 92.3 and 96.7
text:
Fat Joe & Remy Ma Talk Being The Best In The Game, Memories of Big Pun, Staying Independent & More 
- Getting nominated for a Grammy and congratulating Chance The Rapper 
- Holding the release of the album due to the success of All The Way Up 
- Remy suffering through her miscarriage, speaking to the doctor and sharing her experience with the world 
- Papoose 's support through the whole thing and knowing how to comfort Remy 
- Pap & Remy's real love and why they're compatible 
- Staying independent, keeping their creative freedom and having their control of their masters 
- Remy dropping freestyles, calling out females like Nicki Minaj in hip hop 
- Joe being over 40 years old and staying relevant in the game 
- Memories of Big Pun and Fat Joe being the fun police 
- Collaborations on their upcoming album Plata O Plomo including Ty Dollla $ign , The Dream , Sevyn Streeter and Stephanie Mills {"position1":{"name":"Remy Ma","id":27302,"url":"https:\/\/www.iheart.com\/artist\/remy-ma-27302","type":"artist","errors":null,"tagged":true}} ON AIR: Weekdays 6AM-10AM The Breakfast Club is a four and a half hour morning show featuring DJ Envy, Angela Yee and Charlamagne Tha God's unrivaled interviews with celebrities and hip-hop artists. From megastars like Justin Bieber, Nicki Minaj and Arnold Schwarzenegger to rap icons such as Rick Ross, Waka Flocka and Gucci Mane, every guest visiting The Breakfast Club is grilled with their signature blend of honesty and humor. The results are the best interviews to be found on radio.The Breakfast Club includes segments such as Angela Yee's Rumor Report, Donkey of The Day, and DJ Envy's People's Choice Mix. Angela Yee informs the listeners about pop-culture news during Angela Yee's Rumor Report, while The Breakfast Club gives their unique views on each topic. During Donkey of the Day, Charlamagne tha God chooses a public figure or celebrity to poke fun at after public missteps. DJ Envy's People's Choice Mix consists of 25 minutes straight of DJ Envy's award winning music mixes. Social
